Class Observation

  • java.lang.Object
    • Observation

  • public class Observation
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    CS2334. Modified by: David Jones & Will Booker

    Date: 2015-09-28
    Project 3

    This class represents individual, real-valued observations. This class explicitly addresses the fact that some observations are invalid.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean valid
      Indicates whether the observation is a valid one
      private double value
      The observed value.

    • Constructor Summary

      Observation constructor: construct an invalid object.

      Observation constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Observation

        public Observation(double value)
        Observation constructor.

        Values that are larger than -900 are assumed to be valid

        Parameters:
        value - The value to be stored

        public Observation()
        Observation constructor: construct an invalid object.

    • Method Detail

      • isLessThan

        public boolean isLessThan(Observation o)
        Compare this to o. Return true if this is strictly less than o
        Parameters:
        o - Observation to compare with
        Returns:
        true if 1) this is valid AND 2) o is invalid OR this is less than o

      • isGreaterThan

        public boolean isGreaterThan(Observation o)
        Compares this to o and returns true if this is strictly larger than o
        Parameters:
        o - Observation to compare against
        Returns:
        true if 1) this is valid AND 2) o is invalid OR this is strictly larger than o.
